content: have only two needles facing each other use kitchener stitch to graft sts together picking up your heel using a tapestry needle carefully pluck out the piece of scrap yarn and slip stitches onto dpns being careful not to drop or unravel your work you may find it helpful to set up a lifeline with the row above and below your scrap yarn row to ensure no stitches are dropped once you ve picked up your 60 stitches set up on dpns as you did with the toe from bor 15 30 15 work 2 row in toe color using the skein that has been waiting for you o when i work the first row i always pick up 2 extra stitches in the gaps between your front 30 and back 30 sts then i just knit those extra stitches into the first stitch on your waiting needle like a decrease k3tog this will close the inevitable gap that comes with the afterthought heel process begin decreasing as you did with the toe except work 2 decrease row k 1 row work 2 decrease row k1 row continue until you have 28 sts left * graft together as before *the reason i decrease faster on the heel is because i found that a smaller heel makes for a more reliable stocking shape like us on facebook www facebook com/simplyserving1 visit our shop at simplyserving etsy com leg charts approximately 32 row 8 for the name 25 for the charts below this is the part where you may have to do a bit of math especially if you re doing a set of stockings and want them all to be the same size remember to work your charts the way you are working your stocking top down if working graphs from the top down is a little too unconventional flip the page around so they are all upside down repeat charts around as many times as stitch count allows i e 15 st chart repeats 4 times around and so on 6 12 6 30 like us on facebook www facebook
